lugarp1: Being outdoors, seeing vegetation and the sky, feeling in touch with nature, are associated with high levels of emotional well-being.
lugarp2: For the exhibition Um lugar para estar, a virtual reality experience, with the same title of the exhibition, a 3D printed sculpture, and a diptych of digital prints are presented.
lugarp3: Um lugar para estar (2018–2019) introduces the notion of being present at a natural environment from a virtual environment, viewed in virtual reality. It's proposed that similar emotional effects be obtained between the natural and the virtual — from a moment of complete immersion.
lugarp4: Terreno (2019), a 3D printed sculpture, is presented on a plinth. The portion of space utilized for the construction of the virtual environment introduced in Um lugar para estar was physically materialized in a miniature. From a small scale, perception and notion to the spatial dimension of the virtual environment of Um lugar para estar are proposed to the public.
lugarp5: Incidência de luz em um ambiente virtual (2019) presents a diptych of two digital prints, The digital prints the same portrait of the virtual environment of Um lugar para estar, differentiated by the incidence of simulated light on the virtual environment: daytime and nighttime.
tropical1: In Paraíso, a film with the same title of exhibition and a painting of direct relation to the film are presented.
tropical2: The film Paraíso (2017) records the artist Chiaki Mihara, in an environment of abundant nature, producing a painting that introduces a spatial rereading of the present Atlantic Forest scenery.
tropical3: Produced during the film Paraíso, the painting Mata Atlântica (2018) is presented framed in the exhibition.
mundoAberto1: The human brain's response to the perception and notion of an environment is primarily conceived and processed from the light, color, and texture present in a space.
mundoAberto2: For the exhibition Mundo Aberto, a virtual reality experience, with the same title of the exhibition, is presented.
mundoAberto3: Introduced in virtual reality, a digital spatial composition of total area with vast dimensions, is presented in Mundo Aberto (2017–2018). The experience in virtual reality proposes to the viewer an exercise to the possibility of free autonomy in space. In Mundo Aberto, notions of spontaneity of action, presence in space, and spatiality is built in a virtual environment.
